text:
ur 
CORD PROLAPSE 
• In cord prolapse, the umbilical cord comes out of the cervix in front of the fetal presenting part, with the
membranes ruptured. Frequently, the cord may appear at the vulva.
o call for help
o explain the problem to the woman
o perform vaginal examination
• If the fetus is alive (fetal heart heard) and viable gestation:
o If the cervix is fully dilated and the fetal head has engaged in the pelvis immediately deliver the baby
by vacuum extraction or forceps delivery if necess
